fields.description:
For the billed number of users for the instance it shouldn't be the number that is present at a given day on the instance.

Number of users billed should be the number of users that are active on the instance for the whole month and if some users are active only for few days, then they should count as the fraction of the licence,

so for example if 490 users are active all month and 30 users are active only for 1 day in this month, then 30 users would count as 30 * (1/30 days) = 1 licence.

If this collides with current JIRA payment model (upfront?), then the bill for the upcoming period should be as for the previous period and if total number user licences (per daily base-usage) goes over the current tier during that period, the amount for the difference between higher and charged user tier should be charged for the next billing period.
fields.summary: change monthly billing for user tier to be more precise

fields.description: The standard Windows build server does not include NuGet/Visual Studio so we have to create our own build servers. It would be nice if the standard build server contained some more .Net features, saving us the hassle of creating and maintaining our own.

fields.description:
||Atlassian Update - 20 August 2019||
|Hi everyone,
 Thank you for giving your feedback and time. After considering how our customers use our storage, we have decided to make the following changes to our Jira and Cloud offerings: 
 * We have increased Standard storage for Jira and Confluence products from 25GB to 250GB.
 * We have an *unlimited storage offering* for customers who purchase[ Premium\|[https://www.atlassian.com/software/premium]] for either Jira or Confluence, on top of other benefits Premium customers will get.

As a result, I am marking this ticket as DONE. For more information, please check out our [Cloud storage policies\|[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/storage-for-jira-and-confluence-873871366.html]].
 Please let me know if you have any questions.
 Best regards,
 Jenny Chu
 *Product Manager, Atlassian Cloud*\||

 

—

Currently, the cloud disk space limit is 25 GB.

Ideally, customers should have the ability to select the amount of disk space they require and, in future, be able to upgrade if needed. This should ideally be done via paid disk space tiers and not necessarily by user tier.

A related ticket (CLOUD-7509) recommends increasing disk space by user tier. I expect there are 10 user licensed instances that could leverage 100GB+ and 2000 user licensed instances that will never exceed the existing 25GB limit. Offering disk space options outside of user tiers should incur a more efficient use of available storage and provide customers with payment options that provide a greater ROI to Atlassian based on storage efficiency alone.
fields.summary: Incorporate disk space tiers for cloud services
Portuguese PT-PT

fields.description:
We have a use case whereby tickets are raised into us that revolve heavily around UPCs. We regularly find that tickets are duplicated for the same release i.e. the same UPC is entered on two different tickets.

We would greatly appreciate the addition of an on-create ticket validator that checks the value of our UPC field against the UPC values that already exist for that ticket type. This would prevent duplicates being added into our system.

I can see wider benefits for this piece of validation in many lines of ticket requests.

Thanks
fields.summary: Add Ability To Validate An Entry Against Others For Duplicates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[This documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/browsing-a-project-735937233.html] gives instructions on how to get to the "Activity page" of a project. It says:
{quote}
When you select a project to view for the first time, you'll taken to the project Activity page.
{quote}
And:
{quote}
You can access the project activity screen by selecting the Project drop-down, and selecting your project from the list. If your project is not listed, select View all projects to search for your project.
{quote}

Neither of these statements are true. To get to this page, you actually need to click the project's name on the top of the left menu.

The image below illustrates:
!activity_page.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Either change the documentation or how to access the page.
fields.summary: Incorrect documentation

If I click *details* the report appears to generate correctly, just not the widget/gadget.

This appears to mirror the experience of some other people also, see below.


[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24648698/since-monday-the-timesheet-gadget-is-not-working.]

[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24651633/timesheet-gadget-error-there-are-no-time-tracking-records-for-the-period.]

P.S. I apologise in advance is this ticket is inappropriate.

h3. Summary
After import, site administration is locked for all users other than _sysadmin_.

-
h3. Steps to Reproduce

User Managent should open.

The message {{Site administration is locked}} is shown.
!siteadministration.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
-

Create an issue on support.atlassian.com to unlock Site Administration

fields.description: Hi I would like to create a kanban board in jira that will feed directly from another project. Within this kanban board I would like to have 2 swim lanes a backlog swim lane and a open swim lane. Once the task/story is pulled from backlog status to open status i would like to have the task automatically assigned to the person who pulled it over and have the current iteration populate. Is there a way I can do this? Will I need to make the board a scrum board oppose to a kanban board?
fields.summary: [Question] Creation of kanban/scrum boards

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 18 July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Over the past 18 months, we've been working hard at building out the functionality of [organizations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-up-an-atlassian-organization-938859734.html] and [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access]. Both the functionality that is available to all customers with organizations and [domain verificationhttps://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html], and the functionality included with an Atlassian Access subscription, map to what is available for our on-premises products with Atlassian Crowd.

This includes:
* Ability to view, deactivate, and delete accounts used across multiple products
* A central view of all the applications you administer
* Ability to set up single sign on (by connecting to a SAML-based identity provider)
* Ability to set up user provisioning and deprovisioning
* Ability to sync groups from AD or LDAP (via a cloud identity provider)
* A consolidated audit log of user and group changes across your company

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Principal Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}

I manage an extranet for partners.  Currently, Confluence OnDemand's Admin console is pretty sparse on user management features.  I need the ability to require users to reset their passwords periodically (or be disabled), identify and disable stale user accounts, generate and export lists of users, etc.

The biggest concern I have is that users leave their current companies and go to one of my competitors.  Unless someone else in that company tells me that user is no longer with them, I have no way of knowing.  This exposes my company's confidential information to a potential competitor.

I would be interested in purchasing a Crowd OnDemand subscription.  This issue is not requesting standalone Crowd integration with OnDemand products, though I can imagine users being interested in that.
fields.summary: Enable Crowd for OnDemand products

Thanks
fields.summary: Problem with Gantt Cloud

fields.description:
I wish it was possible to select the locale of an issue collector screen instead of it defaulting to the administrator's language. The reason is, my web site support two languages, french and english and I created one issue collector for french and one for english. It is not possible to have two issue collector, on for each language.

I asked for support on that problem and after many effort, they ended suggesting to create this issue. Here is the link of the support trail: https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/agent/JST/issue/JST-150662 .

The way I see to arrange this situation is to add a list box with supported locales when configuring the issue collectors. when displaying the issue collector on the web site, it would be of the selected locale.

If you have more questions, you can contact me at ugo_ducharme@hotmail.com
fields.summary: Choose the locale of an issue collector

fields.description:
I added a new 10-user trial tonight for Atlassian Cloud with Confluence only.  After reserving the site name, the site was created and an email was received that the site was ready to go.  There was no opportunity to establish the Admin password.  I searched for default Confluence password but was not successful in finding one that is expected on new Atlassian Cloud sites.  

It wasn't immediately obvious that I had to use the change-password option (with the account name of 'admin') to establish the admin password.  If there was a default admin password, it wasn't presented to me during setup. (Or perhaps I missed it?)
fields.summary: Admin password not set for new Cloud setup with Confluence only

fields.description:
See https://developers.google.com/gmail/markup/actions/actions-overview?hl=en for background on Gmail In-App Actions.

It would be nice to be able to jump from the inbox view straight into:
- a page that had been updated
- adding a new comment

Current flow is see a notification in your Gmail inbox, open the message, click the link into Confluence.
fields.summary: Add support for Gmail In-App Actions for email notifications

fields.description: I have witnessed countless situations in which a new user complains of not having access to a project or a board. For some reason, the new user doesn't figure out that the drop down options shown in "Projects" and "Agile" menu are only the most recent, and that there is an option for showing all projects and all boards. Even when the user enters the boards page, they again see only their recent boards, which might be empty for new users. For some reason, the "All Boards" link to the left is not easily spotted, and the user complains of not having access to the board. I know that all options are there, for those who know how to see them, but the fact is that quite often users just don't see them at all. There might be something you may do to impove UX in this matter.
fields.summary: UX improvement in "Project" and "Agile" menu options and inside the "Boards" page.

fields.description: I have witnessed countless situations in which a new user complains of not having access to a project or a board. fields.description:
h3. Summary
Admin documentation and managing users links found on the System Dashboard do not work. They lead to either a 404 page error or page deleted. 

h3. Environment 
Occurring in JIRA {{JIRA v6.5-OD-08-001}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA
# Click on links under Administrator documentation section

h3. Expected Results
Documentation page loads

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Page Deleted
A page with this title has been deleted. Contact your space administrator if you would like it restored.
{noformat}

{noformat}
Page Not Found
The page you were trying to reach could not be found: it may have been renamed or moved to another space, or the name you requested may be incomplete.
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Go to these links instead 
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/JIRA+Administrator%27s+Guide
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Manage+users+and+groups
fields.summary: Links In System Dashboard Are Not Working

fields.description: I would like it to be possible to link 2 issues and have them auto update each other. For instance, Issue 1 is required to begin Issue 2. So in my scenario the assignee on Issue 1 says it is completed and that automatically updates assignee on issue 2 to begin work.

Sample Summary Neethu

fields.description: When I signed up for https://mariadb.atlassian.net - the first time you get in, it is normally going to introduce you to JIRA (14-15 step process). However, what I saw was a blank area where this introduction needed to be. I found that if I disabled the AdBlockPlus plugin/addon in my Google Chrome, and refreshed the page, the introduction showed just fine. Thus, something in AdBlockPlus is causing the introduction from working correctly. Can you check on your end if you are seeing the same?
fields.summary: AdBlockPlus + atlassian.com gives issues

fields.description:
Currently administrators can select either the dashboard or the space as the default landing page.
Adding the option to set a (custom) general page as a landing page would provide the option to create a custom landing page that isn't a space, but without needing to introduce the ability to edit the default dashboard template (which isn't supported in Cloud).
fields.summary: Provide the option to set a general page in Confluence as a default landing page

Would love to see the resolved comments not only in the popup, but the ability to show them inline in the page for a full view of the review that has happened with the content.

fields.description: We have started using inline comments in Confluence and in general have liked them a lot. However, as I have tagged other users in comments, they have found it difficult to find the appropriate comment and therefore I am not getting the feedback I need from the comments. Would be great to see some sort of feature like 'Show my comments' 'Show comments that tag me' or something along those lines so users can easily find the areas where their feedback is requested without scrolling through all open comments.

fields.description:
*This is the scenario*
We have our own Cloud instance of Jira
We work with other third parties that also have their own instances of Jira
We use our instance of Jira to collect all issues and then create issues in the third party Jira instances
We have proposed the use of Jira cloud to other agencies

*What is required*
Ability to link between the issues in the different Jira instances

*Problem*
It is not possible to use application links between two Cloud instances of Jira (even if both parties agree to it, sharing the link when creating the application link doesn't work)

*Solution*
Enable application linking on Cloud instances managed by different organisations

*Source of information*
Jira help desk
fields.summary: Application links between cloud instances
Defect in the

As an Admin, I'd like to have the _Last session_ values of *User Management > Application Access* updated. Users from both JIRA and Confluence had already logged, but session stills stated as "never logged in". There are 4 instances facing this error, and all of them have these versions as below:
JIRA: JIRA v6.5-OD-08-001
Confluence: Confluence 5.9.1-OD-60-234
fields.summary: Application Access shows "never logged in" for all users

fields.description:
When viewing an issue, its list of sub-tasks only displays Title, Issue Type, Status and Assignee.

I would like to also see the issue key (e.g. PROJ-123) as a column.

In self-hosted JIRA this can be set using the Advanced Settings "jira.table.cols.subtasks" property, but Advanced Settings are not accessible to us cloud users.

Can you change the global configuration to include this field?  All other issues in all other screens are immediately identifiable by their key, so it seems like an oversight to not show this property on the list of sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Show the sub-task issue key (ID) in the sub-task list

Please let me know if there would be other details needed on this issue.

Thanks.

fields.description:
We currently use confluence for teamwork with many different customers. One BIG problem we have in spaces for a specific customers/projects is when using mentions. Practically one customer can see all our other customer we are working with. The mentions functionality is very good but deeply flawed. If we can not have the option to decide if mention should filter per space (users who have access to the space) or not.

So i got the suggestion to turn the plugin off. I can find the plugin in confluence plugins but see no option for turning it off.

Is this something you are looking into or did i misunderstand something here? Anyway need help quickly. First of all how do I turn it of? Second whats your plan for making this functionality better. Must be many users having the same scenario as we have!? 

Wbr
Christopher
fields.summary: Mentions: Option to restrict to confluence space or turn it off

fields.description:
The Atlassian Cloud [IP Address range|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Database+and+IP+information#DatabaseandIPinformation-IPAddressrange] is thankfully documented, but understandably subject to _change from time to time_.

Right now I need to scrape the page from a scheduled job to get an alarm when the IP address range changes (assuming/hoping, the page is timely updated).

It would obviously be much more convenient and esp. reliable if you would publish the IP address range via an official REST API - the [GitHub Meta API|https://developer.github.com/v3/meta/] approach to this is exemplary, but just publishing and updating a resp. statically hosted JSON document like the [AWS IP Address Ranges|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-ip-ranges.html] are handled would be entirely sufficient for starters.
fields.summary: As an operator, I want to GET the Atlassian Cloud IP address range via a REST API so that I do not need to scrape the docs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Cloud Customers cannot directly import from Mantis Bug Tracker like JIRA Server instances can

h3. Suggested Solution
Include Mantis Bug Tracker as an option with the JIRA Import Plugin for Cloud
 
h3. Workaround 
- CSV Import from Mantis to JIRA Cloud
or
- Setup Staging JIRA Server Instance, Import Mantis to Server, Server > Cloud Migration
fields.summary: Native JIRA Import Support from Mantis into JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
When add the Confluence Page Gadget on a JIRA Dashboard the gadget keeps blank and is not possible to edit. See screenshot.

*Steps to Replicate:*
 # In Confluence, choose the *Help* icon at top right of the screen, then choose *Available Gadgets*.
 # Find the gadget you want and copy the Gadget URL link to your clipboard.
 # In JIRA, go to the dashboard by clicking Dashboard at the top left of the screen.
 # Click *Add Gadget > Manage Gadgets*
 # Paste the gadget URL and click *Add Gadget*
 # Try to edit the gadget, it's not possible, only a blank window is shown.
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget is not working on JIRA

fields.description:
The documentation below seems to be out of date and it is possible misleading.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/__installing+the+Universal+Plugin+Manager

It implies the user has access to the home directory in Cloud.
Ether removing it or updating it is necessary.
fields.summary: Possible out of date documentation.

fields.description:
It would be useful if users could edit attachments in Confluence without directly downloading them, then editing the file and finally uploading.

A feature such as automatic synchronization would allow for a seamless workflow. 

Something similar to [Configuring a WebDAV client for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence]
fields.summary: Automatic Synchronization For Attachments In Cloud

fields.description:
There are two cases here.

*Case 1*
If, when logged in, I navigate to a filter (perhaps via bookmark), it loads for a split second, then disappears. I see a list of my favorite filters to the left, but nothing on the right. 

*Case 2*
If I have a lot of favorite filters, and I manually navigate to one that normally appears very far down in the list of favorites, I can't scroll the list of favorite filters anymore.

Sometimes, instead of seeing nothing, I actually see that the entire page has moved all content upwards, but I can't scroll back up.

This occurs in firefox and chrome--and since firefox doesn't have any custom extensions like my chrome does, this seems to be a problem general to anyone with a lot of favorite filters. I think there is some kind of automatic scroll trying to occur, perhaps to make it more apparent which filter is being shown (make it bold and such), but things are breaking down on the way. 

*Known workaround:*
# Don't use bookmarks. 
# Load list of favorite filters
# Scroll to the one that is wanted, then click on it.
fields.summary: Navigating to filter results in irreversible auto-scrolled content

fields.description:
Confluence gadgets are not working when added to JIRA Cloud.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Follow the documentation below in order to add Confluence Gadgets to JIRA:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+a+Confluence+Gadget+to+a+JIRA+Dashboard

2. Add Confluence Page gadget to a fresh dashboard.
	
	It won't be possible to edit the gadget, adding the wanted parameter to it

3. Add Confluence News gadget

	Also not editable, and once you refresh the page, all gadgets are gone
fields.summary: Confluence Gadgets not working properly on JIRA

fields.description: Starting this weekend I've had several users complain that they are receiving authentication errors when trying to sign into Jira cloud using their Google credentials.
fields.summary: Authentication with Google apps is not working

fields.description: zcfr
fields.summary: udfjkasn

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to copy an entire Service Desk. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Being able to copy a Service Desk will help to optimize the creation of service desks that are similar.
For example, when there is the same request types and SLAs for each service desks.

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Add the ability to copy an entire Service Desk
ghjtyjyukihkhjkhjkhjkgyt

fields.description:
Confluence Cloud Backup Manager Screen:
https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/ondemandbackupmanager/admin

*Going to an Self-Hosted Instance*
You can export and then import your data into a Self-Hosted Confluence instance. Currently, Confluence 5.3 and newer versions are able to import OnDemand backups.
If Confluence Self-Hosted 5.3 is not available for download yet, you can locally install version 5.9.0-OD-54-004 and then restore your data. See more details about version 5.9.0-OD-54-004 in our documentation.

*Issue:* 
# Documentation URL references [OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+OnDemand+to+a+Confluence+Installed+Site], which does redirect to [Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+Cloud+to+Confluence+Server] but it wasn't clear if the redirect is by design. Can we avoid the redirect?
# Seems unnecessary to point at Confluence 5.3 now, can we remove the reference? 

*Restoring to an OnDemand Instance*
You can also use this backup to restore your data into an OnDemand instance.
Important: At the moment, OnDemand instances have limited support for big backup files. Please, refer to the Site Import page for information on the current limit supported and alternatives available.

*Issues:* 
# Several references to OnDemand instead of Cloud. 
# Link to [Site Import page|https://pebbles.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/import/importconfluencesite.action] also references OnDemand instead of Cloud

*Import a Confluence Site*
So sorry! The site import is not available for Atlassian OnDemand sites that have both Confluence and JIRA. (It works for Confluence-only sites.)
Now what? You can import your Confluence data at the space level. If you want to import all the content of a Confluence site into Confluence OnDemand, you can do it by importing the spaces one at a time. Please refer to Importing wiki data for more details.

*Issues:*
# Link to [Importing wiki data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+wiki+data] goes to AOD space instead of ConfCloud space
# Link to [Exporting wiki data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Exporting+wiki+data] goes to AOD space instead of ConfCloud space
fields.summary: Confluence Administration Backup Manager Page Documentation

fields.description:
While in the editor, and having made changes to the page, I clicked on "Create".  Then selected a template and filled out the blank fields.  Upon hitting create, FF asked me if I should leave page or not.  I answered "Stay on page".  Confluence hangs.

Uploaded images show the sequence to reproduce the hanging behavior.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud hangs on Firefox after "stay on page"

fields.description: What are the "special characters" you recommend against?  Can page names have accented characters, (é, ñ, etc.) as they would, for example in Spanish?  Can page names have dashes?
fields.summary: We recommend you don't use special characters in page or attachment names

fields.description: Currently it is not possible to prevent users from deleting their own comments. The "Delete Comments" permissions only prevents other users from having their comments deleted by some different user.
fields.summary: As an admin I'd like to prevent users from deleting their own comments.

fields.description:
Hi.

I don't have a lot of details only that he can't log in. I have tried multiple password resets for him.

Can you please confirm he has received the invite and can log in.
fields.summary: User nick on our account claims he had not received invite emails and can't log in

fields.description:
Hello, 

When I create a page in confluence that is connected to a space that was created automatically from a jira project, I get the following error: 
Error: RuntimeException occurred while performing an XHTML storage transformation (In template Confluence.Templates.Macro.MasterDetail.contentLink2: When evaluating "contextPath()": Error while computing function "contextPath()": null)  and the page is not visible in the jira project at all.
fields.summary: Jira / Confluence error

fields.description: Trying to get the Gliffy plugin from Marketplace. The window shows an exception asking to try again later after some time.
fields.summary: Gliffy Plugin not able to plug into Jira

fields.description:
The top bar's right corner of Confluence has a Notifications button that will display indicate when I got a new notification from JIRA or Confluence. I'm not interested in these since I already get e-mail notifications, so it's just distracting to see something there.

Please make this configurable, preferably per user, with a global default.
fields.summary: Opt-out of Confluence online notifications

fields.description:
The top bar's right corner of JIRA has the Help button that will display a red dot when some news come up (essentially Atlassian ads). I'm not interested in these, it's just distracting to see something there every day.

Please make this configurable, preferably per user, with a global default.
fields.summary: Opt-out of JIRA Help notifications

fields.description: Opening a release (version), i.e. https://company.atlassian.net/projects/KEY/versions/versionId will list issues by their state. However all To Do issues are under "Issues Done".
fields.summary: Releases show all To Do issues as Done

fields.description:
As per our CAC documentation under the *What data is backed up* section [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Exporting+issues#Exportingissues-Whatdataisbackedup] : 
{quote}
The backup includes the following data:

Issues
Users and their group settings
Avatars
Attachments if selected
{quote}

As a Cloud Administrator, I would like the ability to exclude *Users and their group settings* as its possible to exclude Attachments and Avatars.
fields.summary: Exporting Issues > Option to Exclude Users and their group settings

fields.description:
In confluence, there's an option to create a new Jira ticket for text highlighted. I'd like the option to assign the text to an existing Jira ticket in our backlog. 

More often than not, as a PM, I'm interested in capturing the notes from various customer interactions and making sure it is referenced in my single backlog item instead of creating multiple tickets and de-duping them. This helps me capture feedback from multiple customers into one feature request (the essence of product-market fit). 

Right now, the only way to do this is the add a comment in confluence and find the URL to a Jira ticket (which is also difficult - I'd rather browse and search from while i'm writing text using auto-complete, like I can do with other confluence pages).
fields.summary: assign Jira ticket to confluence page

fields.description:
Bamboo Cloud is shutting down elastic instances due to being updated and restarted during weekly maintenance. 

It would be beneficial if a notification was sent prior to weekly maintenance as well as not shutting down elastic instances.
fields.summary: Bamboo Cloud Shuts Down Elastic Instance Due To Weekly Maintenance

fields.description:
Hi - we are looking to incorporate a business critical workflow through JIRA but the blocker is that at certain stages we need multiple assignees to receive notifications that a new "issue" or ticket has been raised and work is needed to be done. At present I can only seem to manage to assign to one "person" or user - which i know is JIRA functionality but it blocks this whole workflow step. I'm hoping someone has previously investigated this and come up with alternatives - I've googled answers for this problem but none that fit what I need.

Happy to talk through the process with a JIRA expert if available.

Regards
JP Cameron
fields.summary: Multiple assginee / emails for Workflow step

fields.description:
Nice job moving the metadata to the top of the page when in edit mode.  The release notes indicate that restrictions, labels and location have all moved to the top of the page near the breadcrumbs.  However, I think there are still some inconsistencies:

View Mode:  
   Restrictions - top of page
    Labels - Bottom of Page
    Location - not shown, which is probably fine because the breadcrumbs serve that purpose

Edit Mode:
    Restrictions - top of page
    Labels - top of page 
    Location - not shown, can no longer be edited here.
fields.summary: we've moved the location, labels, and restrictions buttons to the top of the page next to the breadcrumbs.

fields.description:
There already is a hosted CF plugin available for Bamboo. I would love for this plugin to become available in the Cloud version of Bamboo. Right now I have to use the Maven Cloud Foundry plugin which makes me have to download my repo during deployment time and stick artifacts into their original directories so I can call the Maven plugin goals to push.

The other option is to use Cloudbees but I would prefer to stay on Atlassian Cloud because of its integration with Jira.
fields.summary: Support pushing to Cloud Foundry
